item.title: Dotnet Core 3.1 appsettings mapping with IOptions, IOptionsSnapshot and IOptionsMonitor
item.description: Check official documentation here For a behaviour summary for each interface see here Usage I prefer to create a section called Settings to keep all the parameters, so I’ll follow this approach. Define AppSettings (or you name it) class class AppSettings { public string AadTenantName { get; set; } public string AadClientApplicationId { get; set; } } Create corresponding parameters in appsettings.json { "Logging": { "LogLevel": { ..... } }, "AllowedHosts": "*", "Settings": { "AadTenantName": "comercia.
